mainText.attr1: Void Destroyer has been designed with the goal of giving - you the player - a memorable experience. Meaning that achieving victory is intended to be challenging.
You and enemy forces have particular sets of strengths and weaknesses.
If you ignore an enemy's strength or current circumstances against your favor, you are intended to lose.
There are usually a few ways to handle a situation.
Sometimes retreating, or going on the defensive is the intended path of the story.
Due to player feedback I decided to include the option to lower the difficulty.
Although my goal is that you never need or want to use this feature - I would rather that you lower the difficulty rather than quitting the game in frustration.
There's two ways to control difficulty:
Constant player ship damage reduction (can be toggled on/off at any point) and one time enemy ship health reduction (can be used as many times as you want).

In the - in game - menu clicking on the Difficulty button gives you the option to lower enemy ship health. This only affects ships within 2k distance of a friendly ship, doesn't persist across save files and isn't cumulative.
If you so chose - you can get past a particularly sticky (or ill designed) spot and then continue.

Consider avoiding this feature in the early game, because you might be missing a key component of the game that greatly increases survival (ship building, tactics, defensive platforms, command ship upgrades and abilities). Consider looking at the game guide - mission tips section. If that doesn't help - then using this feature could help you get past a particularly challenging (or ill designed) spot and thus continue to learn the game, making future challenges more manageable.

PLEASE NOTE: The story/mission structure of the game sometimes relies on overwhelming force to shepherd the player or signal that the player chose a non-intended course of action/path. Using these difficulty options may interfere with this.
'If you know your enemy and yourself, you will never be defeated.' - Sun Tsu
